meanings.definition: The breakdown of complex molecules in living organisms to produce energy.
meanings.sent1: During catabolisms, molecules are broken down to make energy.
meanings.sent2: Cells rely on catabolisms to extract energy from nutrients.
meanings.sent3: The catabolisms in the body work like tiny energy factories.
meanings.sent4: In nature, catabolisms act as the dismantlers of molecular structures.
meanings.sent5: The concept of catabolisms can be likened to a power generator within cells.

meanings.definition: The metabolic process of breaking down molecules to release energy.
meanings.sent1: Energy is released through the catabolisms of molecules.
meanings.sent2: The body's catabolisms play a crucial role in energy production.
meanings.sent3: The catabolisms in our bodies are like little energy factories at work.
meanings.sent4: Catabolisms are the energy liberators within our cells.
meanings.sent5: The process of catabolisms can be visualized as a power plant within our bodies.

meanings.definition: The chemical reactions that break down molecules to release energy.
meanings.sent1: Chemical reactions involved in catabolisms release energy for cells.
meanings.sent2: Catabolisms involve specific chemical reactions to release energy.
meanings.sent3: The catabolisms happening in our bodies are like a chemistry show.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, catabolisms are the energy providers.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing catabolisms can make the energy release process more understandable.
